name: Mitigation Playbook for PowerShell Command Abuse Incident
description: Addresses a security incident involving the execution of malicious PowerShell commands on internal servers.

action--c1737847-e44c-40e9-a53c-e98b2d29.name: Kill the malicious PowerShell process
action--c1737847-e44c-40e9-a53c-e98b2d29.description: Terminate any running PowerShell processes that may be executing malicious commands.

action--7f58d82c-6c3d-45f8-9f21-df6940a9.name: Isolate affected hosts from the network
action--7f58d82c-6c3d-45f8-9f21-df6940a9.description: Prevent affected hosts from communicating with the network.

commands.command: if [ $(hostname) == 'host-22' ]; then iptables -A INPUT -s 0.0.0.0/0 -j DROP; fi

loop--9817c27f-fb82-4311-9c31-efc7e843fd.name: Scan for additional malicious files
loop--9817c27f-fb82-4311-9c31-efc7e843fd.description: Repeatedly scan the system for malicious files until no threats are found.

action--9817c27f-fb82-4311-9c31-efc7e843.name: Scan for malicious files
action--9817c27f-fb82-4311-9c31-efc7e843.description: Find and scan all executable files across the network.

action--check-scan-status.name: Check scan status
action--check-scan-status.description: Set the condition variable based on the scan result.

commands.command: if [ $(clamav_status) == 'clean' ]; then echo 'clean'; else echo 'unclean'; fi
